jIYlSJRg4QVoGNotTGJJmg.text: still on the fish & chips hunt and gastropub Bumpkin does not disappoint.  dinner mates also shared the pan-roasted salmon w/ purple broccoli and the  Buccleuch pork roast w/ braised red cabbage.  simple country-food-in-the-city. all organic, farm-fresh,  english seasonal goodness. even better, you can eat well for not a lot of money.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom

EWn82aco5ZPPhZuq4IUS-w.text: I almost put 5 stars - because dinner just now was about as perfect as it gets. I can't believe I have only just discovered my slice of sticky toffee pudding heaven! But before rushing headlong into dessert (tempting though that is...) I guess I should show a modicum of decorum and talk about the rest. I hesitated about booking given some mixed reviews - but a friend who bakes for a living and therefore should know her stuff, highly recommended it. It was even better than I anticipated. Warm, cosy, welcoming on a wet and windy night, the service was really friendly given what a busy Saturday night it was. I had the pumpkin pearl barley risotto, which was absolutely delicious - I can safely say I polished off the lot. After a crisis of indecision over the menu - too many choices, which all sounded great - my  friend really enjoyed his charter pie with a side of heritage carrots. There were no quibbles over dessert, though - we both went for the sticky toffee pud - his with the advertised ice cream, mine with extra toffee sauce instead. Now I've eaten a lot of sticky toffee puds. I've even judged them in the Great Taste Awards. So I really know my puddings. And this was, quite simply, the best ever. Incredibly moist, dense without being heavy - the sauce had just the right hint of treacle to stop it being too sickly sweet. Oh, who am I kidding? It was just lush. I've already booked to go back again next month.

hnk_egOgcEycFVi-d-UQEg.text: Went here for a weekday lunch based on positive internet reviews. My husband LOVED his burger and I had a meat pie that was very good. The atmosphere/decor was comfortable, yet trendy. A nice place to go that is also baby friendly (at least they were to us, at lunchtime).

rP5UEEmkFk0dFZHWa9naMA.text: We were staying at a hotel in the neighborhood and I actually found this restaurant through on yelp and another site....and I can truly see why it's as highly regarded as it is. It has a great "hip/casual energetic feel" to it along with an attentive but not overbearing wait staff who were friendly, polite and best of all, not condescending and adjusted the pace of the meal to our timing and not that of the kitchen! The menu was a mix of the "British Classics" along with some wonderful and creative selections. What a pleasure to find this place and we'd definitely be back when we return to London!

isK4_o62V_ab5Ag-7jwS6w.text: After nearly 10 hours on a plane from San Francisco we were burnt out, crispy and tired, so what better than some good old fashioned honest comfort food to make you feel human again. I used Yelp to find this place that just happened to be a short walk from our Hotel. We braved the biting London cold and headed out to find some grub. I liked the look of the place as soon as we walked through the door. Lots of rustic wood layers everywhere and old English country nick nacks add to the warm and inviting cozy feeling that greets you, there is a small bar at the front and the eating area is at the rear with an open kitchen. Super friendly young staff took our orders of pear, blue cheese and endive salad with creamed artichoke soup and a Charter pie (chicken, mushroom, bacon, white wine and cream with a huge flaky crust top) with a side of butter mashed potatoes all to be washed down with an ice cold creamy Guinness for me and a glass of champagne for the missus. The food hit the spot, only the finest fresh British organic ingredients are used and it shows in the simple but delicious dishes Bumpkin serves. My jet lag was replaced by a warm sleepy coma, ZZzzzzz, perfect. Until we stepped outside to be rudely slapped wide awake by the relentless cold, hello London! I've missed you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Bumpkin Kitchen
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Charter Pie

M412e8DbmHcuL47E0F6mYQ.text: Yummy roasted food.Visited Bumpkin when I was across the pond last November after it had recently opened.  I would recommend reservations as we tried one night to walk in without them & were turned away.  After our first visit we liked it so much we returned a few nights later.  The salami they put on the table was scrumptious, we asked for seconds.  The food was delicious & the drinks were tasty.  This is definitely the countryside brought into the city.  The staff was great & I love the little t-shirts they wear, very cute.  The first night we had a drink at the bar while we had a short wait for our table.  The bar is cozy right in the entrance way, a nice spot for a drink.  I recommend the round booth type table around the back for a group of around four.  It's cozy and private. I think they may have outdoor dining in the warmer months which would be nice on this pretty quiet neighborhood street.If you want a nice homey roasted dinner & a good drink make your reservation.

4hZPV8JhBsckU44QsXO4Kg.text: Have been here twice now. First time, a Saturady night in a large group, the service was excellent. Decent food, great NZ white wine. The second time, New Year's Eve lunch with a friend, the service was sloooooooow, compounded by the fact the waitress hardly looked at us and so it was hard to get her attention. On the plus side, a great prix fixe lunch menu. Overall, the food is good, but not as good as I was expecting - for all the "locally farmed, organic etc" I had expected more flavour & quality. I like this place but I wouldn't rush back.

Ntqdn38dZ9l51vmitGT9TA.text: It was just "OK."  The atmosphere and feel of it was nice and the room had a good ambience to it, but the food was average.  Not being an adventurous British food eater, I went with the burger (which is always my go-to).  The paddy and bun were both way too thick and the bun was slightly stale.  The fries were great though. My date enjoyed his lamb pie but again, nothing to write home about.  Probably won't go back as it's just not my favorite type of food.  So take my review with a grain of salt because I am by no means an expert.

ocVaOB133WXwpvhnj1zimg.text: My first Bumpkin experience was in 2007 at the Notting Hill location. We loved everything about it. The ambiance, the bar in the attic and the chicken pie! So when we were stuck in London last week because of cancelled flights, we wanted to go back and have the pie. But the Notting Hill location was closed for some reason, but happily I found out the had a location close by in Kensington.  We went late on a Sunday night and started with a drink at the bar. The place was nearly empty and it was late, but no one rushed us. We both got the Charter Pie (because we are not good at sharing something we really like) and it did not disappoint. Tender pieces of chicken, sweet onion, leeks, big pieces of english style bacon, and with a flaky crust on top. so good!  Hubby had the carrot soup and I had the mushroom toastini  and everything was really good. Service was friendly, fast and not overbearing. Just what we needed.

_cC39OYdWbFE9aE8GZtjMg.text: first place my wife and I ate at when we arrived in london.  great good, friendly staff (even to us tourists) and a fun place to eat.  plus i love the their name!

WU0UUQ9yZZwYKg0t7h7FZg.text: My experience at Bumpkin took me back. Waaaay back to the SAT and its analogy questions. LONDON : SUNDAY ROAST W/ YORKSHIRE PUDDING ::Toronto : RotiNew York : PizzaSan Francisco : BurritoBoston : Lobster RollKnowing my penchant for Sunday roasts and Yorkshire pud, Laura obliged me and reserved a table for us at Bumpkin on my last visit to London.Leon and I started with bloody marys at the bar and they were quite nice. I only wish the Yorkshire pud had been half as nice. It was supremely lacking in the crucial inside light and fluffy elements. This Yorkshire pud made me sad and reminded me more of a plain, pedestrian roll.As a destination for Sunday roast, I would not return to Bumpkin.

8ysE4Bg2ZCOXfMDwythMVQ.text: WARNING: You're about to read a review from a picky, grumpy, hungry Sunday roast wanter, didn't-geter. Take with a grain of garlic salt. (That should have been incorporated in my roast I didn't get.)-----Not, not, not happy that a restaurant known for their Sunday roasts has spontaneously decided to stop serving them. Because it's "summer." Because Laura was pushing a roast all week. Because Miriam's only London request was yorkshire pudding. Because the food gods hate us. Because we're whiny little brats who want what they want when they want it. Take your pick, it's all legit.And although the bloody mary was lovely, the bread was fresh and delicious, the food was locally sourced and painfully fresh, the setting, service, and atmosphere were all rustic and fantastic, we all left disappointed and unsatisfied. Painful when you shell out £121, in'nit?

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. From Website

56FC0h6n2SjHPyHukQWzpQ.text: I came here at the behest of a friend, and was with them for good company.Being an East London Foodie convert it is hard to please me when it comes to West London quality and prices, and Bumpkin, despite all the billings, as one would expect, didn't quite live up to its rustic English charm.I suppose the alarm bells should have started ringing when we arrive and I realise it is in the same spot that Cafe Rouge used to be - Not that there is any relationship between one chain and the other of course!The place was chockablock for a Sunday night, and the the ambiance was good: not to loud and boisterous, as one might expect from the typical Chelsea "toffs".  For a second I thought we might not even get a table, but they found one squirreled away at the back and side, which was perfect for 2.The waitress was courteous, and helpful, and it is the service I can fault the least in this entire equation, despite the ratio of Polish:English staff, that made the place feel a little less "Bumpkin" and a little more "Bumpkinski" - Pardon the little Englander in me, the xenophobe escapes every once in a while, especially when I am talking about English cuisine!I was enticed by the whole roast Pheasant on the specials menu, but alas things started to go all a bit "Pete Tong" the moment it arrived.  The bird itself was cooked "well", probably a tad a on the dry side, the entire dish was rather lacking in the "red wine gravy department" and the roast potatoes, although looking the part, were decidedly under-cooked.  All that said, the brussell sprouts were delish!After a bit of back and forth, including a quick stint of "nuclear action" on the roast potatoes so that they came back looking like an abused prisoners cell mate, the various issues were rectified, but I must say it left me rather wanting and disappointed. My friend had the cow pie, and seemed rather happy with it.  I suppose I should have followed his advice, that being which they are best "known for".Anyhow, with cheeses at £10 a board of three, and "artisanal" bread and butter for £3, along with other over-priced feed, we decided to call it a day at the main course and a couple of rounds of alcohol.No doubt the puddings are wonderful, and I was every so tempted to order up a sticky toffee pudding - the worlds fave dessert, but in the end I just wanted to retreat back to the better side of town and delve into my own well-stocked drinks cabinet and fridge.

6QeM0f-qFn6HkWieIEy6ug.text: No idea why I have heard good things about Bumpkin.  Atmosphere seemed homey and rustic when we came in out of the cold, but the positives stopped there.My husband and I made reservations for dinner to take advantage of the website offer for 50% off your food bill in January.We arrived on time for our reservation, but then had to wait for 20 minutes for our table to be ready.  The hostess never even came to get us from where she had told us to sit at the bar; we finally thought it would be appropriate to ask for a status update and only then were taken to our table.  Seemed they had forgotten about us.Crowded; loud; terrible service.  Waitress never came to check in on us; took 25 mins to get the check.  The food was cold by the time it arrived.  Portions small.  Had the pork belly; both the meat and veg were cold.  Meat was tough and just five bites in my portion-- I was still hungry after my meal.  Mac and cheese starter was the only enjoyable part of the meal--flavourful and warm.The only reason I'm giving it two instead of one stars is because of the 50% off coupon.  Had we paid full price for the disappointing meal would have been a one star disaster.

AW_EnsoZR_Ii3PJlWh5JaQ.text: The idea of a Sunday roast awakens a tumescence of excitement in me. Good food is inherently sexual, and I had high expectations that Bumpkin would treat me well.As their slogan depicts it is indeed a country retreat in the city. The decor is warming and decidedly country. The service was nothing short of excellent in a reserved non-obtrusive country manner. (Are you seeing the trend here?) Even the waitresses were far removed from the glammed up princesses London restaurants tend to offer. Bumpkin tries for authenticity and I believe they succeed.A shortish menu in this calibre of establishment should mean excellence of execution and mastery of flavour and presentation in their dishes. At our table of four two had fish dishes whilst a colleague and I both had the Roast Beef. All our plates were clean by the end yet a lack of contentment was clearly palpable. I simply expected more for the price. I believe one should be full after a roast dinner, and I was not. Even my colleague who rarely cleans her plate polished off the roast and still felt hungry afterwards. The Yorkshire puddings were very dry and flaky and the most disappointing aspect of the food. We were disheartened enough to go elsewhere for desert.I am in no way saying that Bumpkin's food is bad, it isn't. Yet for £18.50 a head, I believe I am in my right to expect more. On my Sunday visit Bumpkin was full of Sloanies' and West London's finest. I am sure this reassuringly expensive eatery will continue to thrive in such a cash rich area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. From website

KKVNmYCzXYt10CWj0DZDuA.text: One of the better meals I've had in London. Had the Fish & Chips which was delicious, with perfectly seasoned/fried fish and surprisingly good hand cut chips. Our table also ordered the steak pie (race reviews) and the soup if the day (amazing carrot/coconut with perfect level of spice). We also ordered with fish cakes special which was alright but didn't compare to the fish & chips. Finished up the meal with a sticky toffee pudding - order one for the table as you only need to eat a few bites! Delicious and perfect way to end the meal. Staff is very gracious, and the decor is inviting and comfortable. If definitely recommend this lovey spot that is a perfect respite from the busy streets of South Kensington!

Pi8A8sGHDBP8rHKqJ5s7EQ.text: We had a nice summer lunch here. It is an interesting mix of pub/restaurant styles, dark decorations and quality food. We sat on the sunny terrace, it was quite pleasent. The food was good but not very rich in tastes. The meringue dessert was a slight dissappointment (I love meringue and don't easily get disappointed). The service was okay, nothing too friendly or helpful but okay. I might go back again!

sZLA-gsNBdRPaIFe_WtPJQ.text: Stepping into the Bumpkin is an immediate escape from the outside world. First thing to do was order a pint of 'Bumpkin Ale', a cracking brew from Kent. The ambiance is one of studied 'rusticness', with mismatched leather studded chairs, proper wooden tables and scuffed up pepper mills. Our waitress was charming and efficient. The menu is simple, serving English food, very well presented. My black pudding and pear salad to start was excellent, my girlfriends beetroot cured salmon equally so. For main course I opted for 'over night roasted belly of pork', which was as good as it sounds and my girlfriend had 'Charters Pie', a chicken, bacon and mushroom affair which was enormous. Crumble and ice cream (made fresh daily), then finished the supper perfectly. We had a quick look at the private dining room upstairs which again had been designed very well - comfortably the best of the various Chelsea pubs. All in all a cracking evening, a great atmosphere within which to spend some time, thoroughly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom

q2O64WCPMhG9gmwJig9c_Q.text: We had an excellent meal at the Bumpkin.  My only regret was not ordering the lamb special, which looked phenomenal.Food is delicious, fresh, and local.  I had a roast beet and heirloom tomato salad to start, my wife a sweet corn soup, my son a carpaccio type dish (I don't think they called it carpaccio, though).  All servings were well prepared, well presented, and quite large.  Main courses were a steak pie, chicken pie, lobster and chips, and chicken breast.  Again, all were outstanding.  Dessert was the chocolate trio, a pudding, and two different types of cakes -- one flourless with a bitter chocolate and the other with nuts.  No complaints about anything, everything delicious and prices were reasonable for the quality and portions.

NCGbrHtaMuUA68AkOPUiJQ.text: My family popped into Bumpkin after a day if riding bikes through London. We cleaned up and came looking for good food and drink. We were hungry and tired, and Bumpkin rejuvenated us. The atmosphere was modern cozy. It was light and open. We were also happy to see a children's menu. My daughter eats almost anything but I was pleased to see child-size portions for her. My older daughter devoured her fish and chips. My husband had the roasted chicken special of the day and declared it the best chicken ever. I had the vegetable soup of the day - very tasty - and a salad. I was very satisfied with the meal. The staff was good. They helped each other and they knew the menu well. They were an asset to the place. It is a bit pricey but it was good. Would come again. A great casual restaurant.

Cuz7WT1nJht2A5z0yqaz_Q.text: A lot of hype about this place, but I just don't see what the big deal is.  We came here on Valentine's Day because it was one of the only places that we could get a reservation, and because we had been hearing good things about it for months.Although the food may be fresh and local, it simply isn't very good, with the notable exception of some truly outstanding mac & cheese.  But the big downer here is the ambiance.  They first tried to seat us at a table next to the server station at the bar, which would've meant getting elbowed in the head every time a waiter came to pick up a cocktail.  No thanks.They then moved us to another table right next to the bussing area (as in less than 3 feet away), which would've meant listening to the sound of banging plates all evening on what's supposed to be the most romantic night of the year.  No thanks again.Although we were eventually moved to a better table, we saw them try to screw over several other couples with those crappy tables as well.

T-k61gUwURn7pJWDsDDAmA.text: I tried Bumpkin for the first time based on the fact that they were listed in the Good Food Guide 2009 - I went back for the second time because I happily learned that they were on that list for good reason.Please don't be put off by the fact that they are situated right next to a bright neon Shell station. That is a bit lame, but once inside you forget completely about the light pollution outside. I think my favorite part about Bumpkin is the decor - they've done a really great job of keeping with that "country farm" theme. Gourds and veggies are proudly displayed around the restaurant (wooden chairs and tables of course) which is refreshing in this part of town.The menu is short and sweet - and that is perfectly fine. The service is slow because of how crowded the restaurant seems to be lately, but other than that, I have no complaints. The food is wonderful - if I could, I would have devoured the mac & cheese. It looked amazing.I feel like this is the best type of place to take out-of-town guests / parents / family members visiting London. It's nice without being too fancy, in a part of town where visitors are most likely staying (Gloucester Road = a million hotels), and serves up great British food.A nice simple winner.

8S1xz4Y56kAZFIMCrIpgHA.text: Whenever I have friends or family in town, I usually bring them to the Bumpkin for a taste of ''classic'' English food.  The food and service are good and the restaurant is very pretty, but the menu is quite punchy for food you can get at a cheaper price at a nice pub.  My favorites on the menu include the chicken and mushroom pie and sticky toffee pudding. My recommendation is if you are looking to dine on English standards but avoid a pub scene, visit Bumpkin!

AjuK5863vnLqLjZpizNETQ.text: Great pub food with a country-like atmosphere.The Sunday roast is very tasty, though a bit on the pricey side.  It is quite busy on Sunday, so if you are looking for a relaxing long meal look somewhere else.The staff are good, but there could be a few more when the pub is that busy.  only expect to see your waiter a couple of times during the meal.Wine list is good, but the real reason you'll come here is for the food.

Zp5e3KVVFbwazX23vgzKJA.text: When I first moved to London a good local friend of mine made a list of all the places I had to try; Bumpkin was near the top.  Now I'm kicking myself that it took me over a year to finally try it - so many opportunities for a good meal wasted! Bumpkin is yet another "eat local, eat fresh" British concept restaurant. But whereas Canteen can feel like eating in a Scandinavian cafeteria (don't get me wrong, I still love it), Bumpkin is like hunkering down in a country cottage - cozy and warm. We had the specials off the blackboard, including the pan seared plaice with purple broccoli - delicious! The fish was cooked perfectly and the vegetables (often overlooked) were good enough that they could have been a meal all on their own.  For dessert we ordered the warm fruit crumble which came with ice cream - the perfect end to a very good meal.

p4dgQeamuUp0KOCoouQ5SA.text: The food was SUPER yummy.  We had the Sunday roast and I'm not complaining one little bit about that.  However, we booked for 11am (long story) for 10 of us.  When we got there they weren't going to let us in and told us they opened at 12.  This was a little confusing.  After we explained our booking they let us in.  After about 20 minutes at the bar hanging around listening to the staff talk about where they were going to buy tinned tomatoes they finally let us sit at our table.  So that was weird.However, I would go back as the food was so good.  Also, it was quite fun to sing Happy Birthday loudly as the usual crowd  weren't really expecting that and the manager did a dance for us.  Success.

acWOcu1xzrSirSSSf8DGyQ.text: The atmosphere is probably the best thing Bumpkin South Ken has going for it. Has a very cute gastropub feel and cosy environment. Service was unimpressive. Nothing negative, but the waitress seemed confused quite often, and they took our bread, which we had to pay for, before we were finished. Food was decent, best was the fish pie, but overpriced. I've had far better meals for £35 and would only go back if there was a voucher.

thyBD9LMWu2KcvH2Ajaicg.text: Cute place, much promise. But they couldn't manage fish and chips. Not great for an English cuisine place...  To be fair, we didn't try the more complex dishes, but I do think a good restaurant deserves to be judged by its take on the classics.

AzFCwQYGhR5Gy-oHLXPwMg.text: Bumpkins is the sort of place I would eat at every day if it were possible! Everything about this place, from the fabulously calm, understated yet classy interior to the delicious wines and cleverly thought-out dishes is perfect for enjoyable dining. I had an amazing dish made from pearl barley and Cornish Yarg, served with some deliciously fresh vegetables, washed down with an English rose wine  perfection! The desserts are to die for too

Pe5eoZvuQYif9-jPfrFSTQ.text: What can I say - Maybe it's a British thing. We thought this place was VERY mediocre and VERY overpriced.

soUUk1-eX-xgf-qSNEctNA.text: Very cool British gastro pub with good food and cozy atmosphere. Service was very friendly and attentive as well. Ambiance was candle-lit and had a farmer feel.All of the food we tried was really good but the skin on the pork belly was a bit hard and crispylike crack your teeth hard! Other than that we had a delicious meal. Generous portions and well cooked food.Mac and CheesePotato soupSlow roasted Dingley Dell pork belly with a celeriac apple sauce, roasted carrot and onionMixed West Coast seafood stew prawns, crayfish, plaice, salmon and a shellfish soup with spiced croutonsCreamy egg custard tart with nutmeg and a jar of rhubarb and custard ice cream

_wvCW1ZA0yc54uiAcwvX3w.text: Decent; thats it. Not good. Not bad. Its too pricey for the punch it packs in dinner execution. Flavour hidden away.

-W6jp0SmYSl9rLtrPkfakQ.text: We made a reservation for a party of four based on a recommendation from a nearby hotel, and our group was well pleased with our dinner. The dining room is lovely and the staff professional and attentive. We found the wine list to be quite nice, as was the beer selection. Between us we ended up with a nice representation of that night's menu including a cottage pie, sea bass, lamb and steak and everybody felt well done by. The sticky toffee pudding for dessert was just terrific. Overall, a very very solid option.

pMW17gh_EJrbpUlYDqCkIg.text: I made a huge mistake ordering the fish pie. What I really wanted was something with a pie crust. Didn't realize the top of this dish would only be mashed potatoes. Also the fish tasted like canned salmon, not fresh salmon. I did not enjoy this dish and probably should have gone with the Sunday roast. Also wasn't impressed by the Eton Mess, basically full of regret about what I ordered...sigh. Service was friendly and helpful.

TVAWRAePaOR3_Ocsy9r0Bg.text: Very nice atmosphere, combo between a pub and restaurant.  The wait was a bit for a Sunday when no one was really present in the area.  I wouldn't rave about the food, it was nice but lacking some flavour.  Items really needed some seasoning, this was the case across four different dishes in our party.For the quality I would say definitely over priced.  I've had much better for less in London.Still a nice quiet place to sit and catch up with family.

140gMg38UacvZhUdbHae-w.text: Lovely dinner spot!Impressed by the cocktail, remind me a bit of the hipster LA mixologist places.Less the hipsters and add in the delicious variety of dishes.The appetizers are a wide variety of yummy choices from fishcake, to ham terrine and bacon wrap scallop.The garden salad was simple green and fresh spinach.  The entrees were all interesting sounding especially and I went with the mozzarella tart.An exquisite tasting tart with fresh tomato.I am not sure if there were any dressing on the tomato but the warm soft lightly salty tart went with the tomato harmoniously.The husband's beef short rib was deliciously flavored and fell right off the bone.Will be back...!!

xdfewcsks7ODT-fGGIohTg.text: We arrived earlier than our friends, checked in with the hostess and went to the bar. We were the only ones at the bar but the bartender, who was very intently making mojitos, ignored us for the entire 10-15 minutes we waited for our friends. At the table, we waited an hour for our food. They were very nice and apologetic and comped us for our wine, but the food was not special enough for me to give them a second chance. Portions were small and none of the dishes were very memorable.

1QViEGU9W3bnYqOmFfvliQ.text: Came here for an afternoon drink and ordered a fresh lemonade. Waited so long and when it finally came it was Sprite. I requested for it to be fresh, and she came back when a drink that was a sour mixture of Sprite and lemon juice. Quite awful.

nOQu0_rLv8zM8LhH1ZSstQ.text: I recently had dinner here and it was fantastic. I had the fish and chips and it was delicious. The side of peas had a twist to it and it was great. They had a good dinner selection and they had some great specials as well. Loved the cozy atmosphere and ambience. Also the service was very good. Definitely recommend this place if you're visiting London.

ngB_aT7mLMjvHzvJ5dkDVg.text: Food was very good, we were very happy. Quality English food. The price was just a tad high but in reason.

FL8Xo6DGXdFKbVwsaA3TPw.text: This was my first visit to Bumpkin.  We were very pleased with the quality of the drinks and food.  Since we hadn't eaten here before, the waiter had to take a lot of time explaining all the choices on the menu, but he did so with patience, despite a full house in which we were very lucky to have been seated without reservations.  The place was obviously very popular, and the ambiance was great, if a bit loud from everyone having such a good time.  We had the delicious aged beef Butler Steak with chips and Torched Salad, with the Damson Passion Fruit Collins.  The manager checked on us several times and was very friendly.  The service and attention to detail were as excellent as the food.  Quite nice, really pleased that we had been referred there by our nearby Bed & Breakfast.

VlJhGHEbqObgGmR5X4BwUw.text: Came here for dinner with friends.  We were a group of 5 and one our friend is allergic to gluten, which we made the staff aware of but there were very slow.  Everyone's starter was out but our friend's (the gluten intolerant one).  We had to flag someone down twice to get his meal out.  The good was OK, nothing great.  And that was how it went the entire evening.  Granted we had fun - but that was because of the friends and laughing at the situation.  I would go with other restaurant choices in the area and give this one a miss.

YT5ThKjpHsFdbrdtyTB5dQ.text: I've had Bumpkin on my bookmarks list for a long time, but ended up going on a date here by complete accident. Parts of the experience I really liked, and parts were mostly okay. The tricky part I've found is that in London, I expect everything to be good, or it just doesn't get those last few stars.I like the atmosphere... my first thought was that it was a pub, from the dark decorations and wood panelling. But, it's definitely a restaurant, because A) there's no  bar, and B) it's all full of tables with a nicely exposed kitchen.I didn't like being seated next to the kitchen, and next to a pole. It made the whole thing feel cramped, and on an early date, these kinds of things can feel really awkward, when it's already an awkward situation.The cocktails were nice, though not super strong. The food was alright, though nothing particularly fancy. I had a burger and my date had the chicken. They both looked wholesome and heavy, though not super healthy. They were already, certainly flavorful but nothing that stood out. I know lots of really great burger places that this wouldn't stand up to.Service was pretty good, which was a redeeming thing, since nothing bad stands out in my mind.Overall though, it was a bit of a mixed back experience. I'm not sure, not living in the area, I would ever trek back that far again.

1-gx-btJjO0zy0_oll1LEA.text: The food was delicious and beautifully prepared--when it finally arrived. Great service but slow and unpredictable kitchen. Not good if you're in a hurry. Ample seating and delightful menu, though.

UjDJj2yDEaNOWvjpVZIMaA.text: We had a lovely dinner at Bumpkin with an overwhelming group of 10.  They were very accommodating and service was very good.  They didn't even bat an eye when we sat with only 9 and the 10th came half way through our main dishes and ordered then.  The food is very traditional British fare and therefore maybe less exciting than some might hope for but they do it all very well and everyone was pleased.  The cocktails were tasty too.  We will certainly return with future guests looking for traditional fare that stands well above pub food!

hC1-eygq2_g1BV12L7OqDg.text: Bumpkin is a delightful little place! My boyfriend, cousin and myself went here for lunch a few weeks ago. We're from out of the UK so we wanted to try something English but not spend an arm and a leg. This very adorable restaurant is nestled in South Kensington and from the outside you would assume it was an ordinary little food place.  The great thing is that it's far from that! Warm, good lighting and lots of guests eating away!The waiter we had was super friendly and helpful. He took our order and it came quite quickly. They even has a "menu of the day" written on the chalk board in the back of the restaurant (kind of where we sat). I ordered a side of green leaf salad and the Charter Pie. The charter pie consists of the "traditional short crust pastry; free range chicken, leeks, mushrooms, bacon in a creamy tarragon sauce".  The crust was soft and still very warm when it arrived in front of me.  It was a small portion but just perfection at every bite.  No complaints! My boyfriend ordered the Shepherd's Pie "mutton and lamb with root vegetable in a red wine gravy baked under Duchess potatoes".  I had one taste of my charter pie and it was absolutely delicious. Although the restaurant was a bit crowded (that probably speaks to the popularity and quality of the food), I really enjoyed the atmosphere and meal. The staff were all very pleasant and it was a good experience to have considering it was my first UK meal. I cannot wait to go back and definitely would recommend this place for out of towners and any Londoners hungry for great quality food.

knpnUU5t4cZp2BGFB3V19Q.text: Good gastropub/brunch place. Tends to be a bit hit or miss at times. Cold food + service being a bit snooty. Else not bad.

xO3L3G7p4YVlJVsvIuS6EA.text: We came for our first dinner in London. Since we were staying in south Kensington this was recommended by our hotel and we were not disappointed. We'd recommend it

tOLqEtbeBb5wP_oHmdAdGg.text: Ate here twice in one day while visiting London. The traditional breakfast was very good.  Each item done well.  We had a light dinner late that night and the food was fun, fresh and flavorful.   Ambiance is very nice for any meal.  Only complaints are that service can be slow for breakfast and the Bumpkin beers aren't all that flavorful.

mWJKcZpd0PMiAKzwvcqnVg.text: Okay.  The food is beautiful and quite delicious so if we are reviewing on food alone...this place is really great.  My only concern today was that I met a friend for lunch and waited at least an hour for my starter "Onion Tart with stuffed tomato".  I think, to be fair, that the server was waiting for my lunch date to finish her soup but he should have asked.  While she ate,  I sat their just waiting.  It was slightly annoying.  The staff was friendly and the food was quite good.  My tart,  once it finally arrived,  was beautiful (see pictures as I have added one of the dish) and tasted delightful.  One random note.  I loved the decor.  It was like a rustic dining room with open views of the kitchen staff as they prepared meals.  I particularly liked the bright green tiles in the kitchen and the array of mirrors on the walls.  Ladies,  check out the wall paper in the bathrooms...super cute.  They looked like what I imagine would happen if a diamond and a snowflake had a baby...To see a photo,  check out my food blog "The Southern Stump".  You can see a link on my profile.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Onion/Mushroom Tart with stuffed Tomato

lBcZF53gYHjyBxL-DAu7vw.text: Came here for our first night of vacation.  We could not have wished for a better spot.  The service was great and the manager was amazing! He took the time to talk to us about our trip and he really went above and beyond to help start our trip the right away! The food was great, I personally love the farm to table concept and the freshness of the beet and goat cheese appetizer was really awesome.  I had the risotto, which was packed with flavor though it was a little dry, my partner had the fish pie, which was very very good and well worth it.  For dessert we had the toffee pudding with the salted caramel ice cream with some tea both were amazing! We will definitely be returning at some point if not later this trip and I would recommend this place to anyone!

xOnBqq2SPn4Shwhw8u5Fgw.text: Very enjoyable staff and locationDuck was greatSimply niceSimply niceSimply niceSimply niceSimply niceSimply niceSimply niceSimply nice

KzBQkV3Oz_LdU0hbFzrFHQ.text: Nice place with good food. Staff was friendly and was a good place to start a visit to London.

GMmQNgucC0SkaqE83tYjAA.text: Great food, great service!! We had dessert and cocktails, both were great and our waitress was so sweet. Loved the ambiance as well.. highly recommend this spot for a nightcap!

xTwaMMcP7mclo9Fy6vOUqQ.text: You know the food was actually good. I would have given a higher rating but for the way the sever and staff made my husband and I feel. After enjoying a lovely lunch we ordered the sticky toffee pudding to split. As our server entered the order someone from the kitchen must have said something, because from the computer where she entered our order, right in front of us, she turned around and said " I don't know, I put my hands up."  The person in the kitchen ( who was out of my view) must have said or did something else because she continued on to say "the menu says it's award winning." I immediately wanted to cancel the order and leave. I don't know if I have ever felt so bad about ordering a dish on a menu in my life. I like to run my mouth but I hope I have enough sense to do it out of the hearing of the people I'm talking about, let slone paying customers, and it wasn't like all we ordered were side salads and water.It sorta stinks that someone's thoughtless behavior ruined an otherwise great meal.

F0LxvRfq8Vyc6jioKdrVWw.text: My family Easter lunch in London after Church, bumpkin  restaurant " was cute place" my wife said and the food, was Wonderful as well, we tried the Mac & cheese, Pot roast, cheese burger and pot Pie all exultant food. Please check this place if you are in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Mens water closet
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Pot Roast
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

dhld_fbmU-60gPxDBg1nUg.text: When my friends and I wanted to find a brunch spot before visiting the V&A, we found it surprisingly hard to think of a good place around South Kensington. Bumpkin came up a number of times during our online research, and it seemed to have good reviews so we went ahead and booked a table. Unfortunately, we didn't realize that brunch is only served until noon on Sunday, so when we arrived, we only had a lunch and Sunday roast menu to choose from.Luckily, most of us were in the mood for roast, so we ordered the chicken and two orders of sirloin. One friend also ordered the sea bass. I tried both of the roasts and thought the chicken was much better than the sirloin, which we ordered medium rare, but came out as a thin, tough piece of meat. The roast was also served with roast potatoes, a Yorkshire pudding, and roast vegetables that seemed to be doused in a creamy cheese sauce. I've had better roast vegetables, but we all agreed that the potatoes and Yorkshire puddings hit the spot.By the time we left the restaurant around 2 PM, the whole place was packed and it is definitely a popular neighborhood spot. I enjoyed the dining experience, but it was not the best roast that I've ever had. I think it is a good option if you are in the area, but I look forward to exploring other places in South Kensington. If anyone has better recommendations, please send them my way!

EtYM_JLUo-8cdIyIOhfsAA.text: Came here for a birthday lunch, and it exceeded our expectations. It's a thoroughly British affair, so order appropriately. The appetizers are interesting - I recommend the crab and the smoked salmon. The highlight was definitely the main though. I had the salmon wellington which was superb, and the steak pie was also a winner. Look on their website for half price promotion.The ambience is somewhat like a bar, but still nice and cosy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Bowl of delicious steak ale pie.
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Crab appetizer, very fresh
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Salmon wellington. Delicious.

1npvaqXEl6KFrz9N5BNJwA.text: Just a short walk from our hotel, we happily stumbled upon Bumpkin our first night and had a great experience.Homey decor and low lighting add to the charm of this gem in Kensington. It has the ambiance of a small family restaurant and the service to match.The menu is just right-seasonal dishes with a hint of tradition, excellent specials and a nice drinks selection.Our first meal (we liked it so much we did go back) is a slight blur due to *a bit* of jet lag, although I do remember the fish and chips being spot on and I loved the mushy peas. One of our party had the chicken which was perfectly done, and one of the specials we had, a chicken and mushroom pie, was stellar.If you are a fan of stouts, the Whistable Bay Oyster Stout is amazing-a must try.After our second visit, my DH and son stayed for drinks at the bar, where they enjoyed more excellent service and a nice selection of ales.The next time we are in Kensington, we'll definitely be back.

i0YYA2L2JM_kCyGLd3x4Tg.text: One of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. The moment we walked in we were ignored by the hostess, a horrible woman with short hair and a contemptible and undeserving sense of pompousness. She told us without looking up for a second in a very cold manner that the garden was fully booked and we needed a reservation, however there was absolutely no one inside, which should have been my first clue that this was not the best place to eat. The garden was occupied by only two small groups of  diners and none of the tables had reserved signs, this should have been the second indication to leave but we stayed and put in our order.The only decent part about our experience was the quality of the food and the accommodating waitresses but we could not fully enjoy it because the plates the food was brought out on were dirty all throughout. They were not washed properly and had bits of food and streak marks.The cherry on top was when an older couple walked in and the same woman who seated us walked up to them in a very cheery and polite attitude and seated them out in the garden without a reservation. We inquired about this situation with one of the managers and were given a bullshit explanation about the timing and not wanting to inconvenience us with moving us if other reserved diners showed up.I will be turning people away from eating here any chance I get. Absolutely horrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Dirty plates

wUVVqOXJ-DBoh8oX9RRY1Q.text: I went to their Christmas Showcase, as a guest of a friend.  I have used their original branch based at Notting Hill, so it felt like I was walking into the same restaurant, as the layout was exactly the same!  The private room above was decked out all Christmassy and was lovely.  The drinks and canapes were flowing, there were prosecco and different cocktails and mulled wine and tasty canapes and desserts to die for.  A lot of staff on hand, and the service was efficient and friendly. The place was packed, so a very lively atmosphere.  We left after a couple of hours having had our fill.  Would definitely recommend their very reasonable Christmas menu at £37.50 for 3 courses.

k7S7HJJ7JtuYsFhbmnrq-A.text: We were tourists in London and this place is just down the street from our hotel. It is very clean and the folks are helpful and welcoming. Our fish & chips and burger were wonderful. Would certainly go back next time we are in town!

FvJ5_mf_Wetu2aJW1XQF3g.text: We spent two weeks in London and had dinner here three times. Completely enjoyed all three visits. The Sunday roast dinners are great as are the traditional dishes. The wine list is also a plus. Great service!  You can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom

fSq20BzaV5I-_JRh2610Cw.text: This place is super cute, but the food wasn't anything special.  My boyfriend had the lamb and I had the Sunday roast - both we fine.  Service was good.  The mac and cheese is pretty tasty.  The atmosphere is quite lovely.

8rDZHl02G5mQCxwcNiQpQA.text: I recently came here for drinks one night and then dined a few nights later. CARLOS at the bar is SO sweet and he made me the best personalized drinks! and when we came to dine a couple days later he remembered me, greeted me with a smile and remembered my special drink and hand delivered it to me! The staff made us feel right at home. So overly impressed with the service. Now for the food - this was not only the best meal we ate in England but in a long time also! it was amazing!!! My husband ordered the chicken and it was probably the best chicken we have ever eaten. I had the meat pie and that was amazing. The macaroni and cheese was delcious and the mushrooms on top were the best mushrooms i have ever had. I will seriously fly to London just so I can eat here! And Salva was a great, sweet and attentive waiter. We will recommend this to everyone and we can't wait to be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Wow! What a meat pie!
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Macaroni with mushrooms

BO_5pURuiyb6LR3uh8pIJw.text: Have gone back few times since my review and have to say that the food has improved.In particular I love their pies!

O3dexjmPwJeGhQVe83NkGg.text: We walked in without reservation Sunday and were able to get a table. I was disappointed when I tried to order the 3 course meal and was told that 2 of the 4 entree options were not available. Therefore, we ordered a la cart. The crab starter is not very good. It's cold crab meat mixed with tomato paste and lettuce served in a crab shell. However, the monkfish and sea bass were pretty good. The wine list was decent. The overall ambience was the best part of my dining experience. I recommend going and checking it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sea bass, delicious crispy skin
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Monkfish
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sea Bass & chips

jSsXFPB2aXfFo0PNT7OthQ.text: For lunch I decided on Bumpkin.  Where they served traditional English fare.  The prices are decent and you feel at home from the moment you walk in.  Looking around everything is done with an eye towards being upscale while still being comfortable and simple.  The warm wooden interior and mixed match chairs gives the place sort of a farmhouse feeling which definitely coincides with the menu that focuses on locality as well as seasonality.  I sat down next to a window that was dotted with several different plants in glass vases of varying sizes that looked to be a hodgepodge of items purchased at a yard sale.  The table was set with a bright yellow flower that used an old soda bottle as a vase.  You couldn't make this venue more comfortable if you tried.  To drink I had a Guinness.  I swear, Guinness is better outside of America.  It actually tastes like a pretty legit stout.  I decided to go with the pork croquettes to start.   This dish was amazing.  You get the tenderness from the roasted pork that is then finely shredded and formed into a perfectly shaped cylinder before being breaded and fried.  The presentation was incredible.  You had this wonderful brightness provided by pickled onions as well as this sweet apple and raisin sauce.  All on top of a little cucumber salad.  It was a great appetizer because even though the roast pork is heavy, it was portioned well and combined with the rest of the ingredients it gave a bit of lightness to the dish that made you want to come back for more.For the main course I had the Fish and Chips, with tartar sauce and mushy peas.  Many people are down on fish and chips and British food in general and I totally don't understand why.  This fish and chip was great.   The batter was crisp and the fish was moist and perfectly cooked.  The fries had the perfect texture, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.  I loved it for it's simplicity.  It was also my first time tasting mushy peas.  I had never been big on peas as a child. It was kind of a point of contention between me and my mother since they are her favorite vegetable.  I despised sweet peas.  As an adult I kind of came around to like peas quite a bit.  These peas were perfect not too sweet and I love the mint that complimented the peas as well.For dessert there was the sticky toffee pudding.  I am not a fan of overly sweet desserts, except when some form of caramel is involved and then all bets are off.  The sticky toffee pudding was bursting forth with this rich sweet flavor.  This is one of those instances where the English language is a barrier, because it wasn't a pudding like what you would think of from an American perspective.  It was more like a cake soaked with a sweet caramel sauce.  I was nearly stuffed but ended up powering through the entire dish.

GQ1qzfSHfXErNN6uSJSZJA.text: We arrived in time for Happy Hour & the bartender made it so fun for us!  He was making up drinks to enjoy during the Olympics & was quite the artist!  Definitely will be stopping by again!

KDsCv98rsnFj4unrNbQchg.text: Very poor service, all of the workers are friends and hang out with each other instead of helping customers. It's more of a social gathering for them rather than a restaurant. Had to go pick up the menu from the waitresses ourselves, never got the 'specials' menu, and lastly had to go up to the waitress to ask for the check after waiting 15 minutes. Menu is extremely vague with what items are in each dish, and this did not help with my spouse's allergies. But when our waitress was around, she was helpful with helping us with that.Food and drinks, although, were very good. Looks like the cooks have their act together while on the contrary, the actual running of the restaurant does not.

xGdBpbt1pZmSBqdQlq8A8Q.text: We found this place because we were looking for sticky toffee in London and this was in the top 10 in an article online. Well, we had to agree because it was the best sticky toffee we had in the UK. We spent two weeks traveling in Scotland and England and this was our favorite! As for other food, we shared the spare ribs, which were fantastic and a perfect starter for two. Then we got steak and ale pie and sizzling chicken and steak. (pictured below) The steak and ale pie was the perfect amount of pastry and it had well flavored meat. The chicken and steak platter was a great portion! Honestly, we were looking at all the meals coming from the kitchen and everything looked good. The service was wonderful, they were very attentive and took into account our special occasion! I highly recommend eating here when coming to South Kensington or even making a trip if staying elsewhere in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. This is the best sticky toffee in the UK. We spent two weeks traveling in Scotland and England and this was our favorite!
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. The steak and ale pie was the perfect amount of pastry and well flavored meat. The chicken and steak platter was a great portion of meat!

hKAAi6NilTQfAiW3N_U8yA.text: Had 2 drinks, the duck salad and steak special. All were delicious! Servers were very friendly and made recommendations on what I should get and the restaurant had a very nice ambiance.

gez8ik5pQK_EwcawBQUzgA.text: Good food, terrific service. Very glad I found Bumpkin. Ordered an ale on draft and a meat pie. Both were tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Good food, terrific service.

zhmUEOBPDijSlKqjFenqVw.text: So I was walking by to my normal croissant spot and took note of the laid back atmosphere of Bumpkin. I have walked by many times, but never ventured in, until today. I started with a detox shot (I might have had a few at the pub in Oxford the previous night), and then a cappuccino. They were attentive, the food was tasty(I had the veggie breakfast with some OJ), and they put on some great music. Outside during the warmer months is right in the sun. For me, I stuck to the lounge area inside to relax and read some good articles. Check it out! I will definitely be returning!

7I6NDBmXIGBIB5uyZMf6Ng.text: Delicious fish and chips and a great server!  This was our favorite meal in London for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with peas!

1l8MiC_mmjnBTv4jTIGjwA.text: This place was fantastic.  Located in a nice part of town, ambiance was great.  We brought our kids, but no kid's menu.  Great for a couple's night out as well.  Food, wine, coffee and dessert were all great.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sticky pudding is incredible!

08ErUun_G2BYImD-iLsgXA.text: We came here for our first dinner in London. I had to go with the fish and chips. The sauce they served it with was delicious. So were the smashed peas but the fish itself was pretty oily. Guess that's to be expected? My husband ordered one of their sausage dishes and enjoyed it. We really liked our dessert. The ambiance was cute and pretty hipstery. Every day we walked past it it looked full of people. I would go back and give it another shot but I wasn't that impressed.

0hiqVbLtEhBaZs6k4BZXwg.text: Absolutely amazing! I came by myself for Sunday Roast. While pork belly was not my first choice I'm so glad I had it! The drink (apple mint) I had was fabulous and the dessert ( white chocolate mouse) was a perfect ending! Service was also so great! Hope to go back before I go back to the states.

vrNDXyqqDmuNJ6pXBPdQsA.text: Maybe we are just too Americanized but I don't see what the fuss is about with fish n chips... It was not that great... And the dessert wasn't that good here either.The service was way too slow!!! Took two hours to get our meal completed and then Had to wait forever for dessert...   Maybe we are just impatient in America but we don't like to wait hours to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Peas!!!
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom

an8S0r1GJwgKcyF47ceofw.text: Went there about two weeks ago and the inside was lovely and the staff was nice.  I asked the bartender to surprise me with a drink and he made me a great aperol one, not sure exactly what was in it but it was good and I'm not a big cocktail drinker.  I would say I'd be back but I live in the US.  I will recommend to friends visiting the UK though :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Aperol cocktail
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Baked goat cheese
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Scallop starter

ORhdDvuTLhcmfiyAap_xwg.text: We came here to celebrate a friend's viva.  We sat in the private room upstairs and it was very lovely! I had the soup of the day (I believe it was butternut squash soup), Salmon Wellington and sticky toffee pudding.The Salmon Wellington and the Sticky Toffee Pudding were outrageously delicious.  The salmon came with a caviar cream sauce that made the dish rich and decadent.  The sticky toffee pudding was probably the best sticky toffee pudding I've ever had in my life. As if the pudding wasn't rich enough, it was stopped with salted caramel ice cream! I might consider returning to Bumpkin just for the pudding. It was THAT good.The service was attentive and the ambiance was lovely.  I would recommend for a relaxing dinner out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Wellington... Highly recommend!!

oCPov4ix2VD-CLcDSzeDNg.text: A 1/2 pint and delicious corn/tofu fritters. Sat outside and enjoyed my quick bite. Seriously, the fritters were so good!

70gfF6u30SWdvwuwYYujFQ.text: Went here for their Sunday Roast. It was delicious! The gravy was incredible. Cocktails and dessert were also on point. I also have to mention the service. The waiters were friendly, helpful and very welcoming.Would definitely recommend going here on a Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding and caramel ice cream.
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Sunday roast.
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. The Eclipse cocktail. DELICIOUS!

73N4tAF3wNJP4dSZbE23AA.text: Right around the corner from our hotel, and I am not complaining. We liked this place so much we ate here two days in a row. lol. The food is farm to table and about 20% of the menu changes nightly. My favorite items consumed included the "meat board" that came with house made cured meats, bread, and pickles. For dinner my favorite meals was the grilled Hake and veggies. yummmmmmm. Keep on doin your thang Bumpkin, you are certainly #winning

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Stick toffee pudding. Rich, but the sauce is great.
Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Get this. Seriously good. They cure the meat themselves

nX9cXEGb4ubNxVWTecYc9g.text: Cute. Tasty meat pie. Reasonably good service. More of a bistro than a pub. A bit pricey for what it is.

fC8DkC9L2z6TJLr4MlsIKg.text: So happy to be back here! We came several years ago and I've held romantic notions of this place since then. We really enjoyed the mix of chef's plates and traditional fare.

eoUWQnWc22BLIth3VtgIYA.text: Eh. The food was decent and reasonably priced.  Their artisan bread was delicious, as was the cod. I had the risotto, which was a bit on the dry side. However the service was very slow. It was almost as if our servers (yes there seemed to have been more then one) kept forgetting about us.

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom. Risotto

jbh5M3GFXWZxy-V3I851RA.text: We popped in here on a lark and so glad we did. We asked for bread with the Twice Baked Goat Cheese and a whole board was delivered. Yum. Longhorn pie was delicately cooked and the crust was perfect. The baked courgette with quinoa was so good I hope to replicate it!  The service was attentive and warm. I loved the charming atmosphere with fresh flowers and candle. We'd come here again if it wasn't 7 hours from home!

photos.caption: Photo of Bumpkin South Kensington - London, United Kingdom

6ngEi36cKmzObhtOAdP8Tg.text: We came here per the recommendation of our hotel concierge. There were many options on the menu, all of which looked delicious. Our server suggested the Hake and Pork Belly with a side of mash. We also ordered the Baked Cheesecake.- The Hake was quite good.- The Pork Belly was tasty too however the skin seemed a little too burnt/crispy as it was difficult to cut and bite.- The mash and baked cheesecake were both okay. I think I just wasn't used to the richness of the dairy.Apparently there's a set menu: 2 courses for 15 or 3 courses for 20 (Monday-Thursday from 12PM-7PM).I will definitely visit a Bumpkin establishment the next time I am in London and have already recommended others to try it out.

pegvENXG61HxbPcLaLRDFw.text: This had been recommended to us by our hotel as being good for kids. It does have a kids menu and there were lots of kids there.  Unfortunately the food was below average.  The burger was over cooked.  Any my fish was very average.  The fried were soggy.   I'd pass.  You can do better in South Kensington.
